identificationModule.briefTitle: Comparison of NT Vs Body Weight Supported TT Along With CT on Lower Extremity in Chronic Stroke Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Comparison of Neurodevelopmental Treatment Vs Body Weight Supported Treadmill Training Along With Conventional Therapy on Lower Extremity Among Chronic Stroke Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To determine the effect of Neurodevelopment Treatment vs Body Weight Supported Treadmill Training along with conventional therapy on lower extremity among chronic stroke patients.

armGroups.label: Body weight supported treadmill training along with conventional therapy
armGroups.description: Using Body weight supported treadmill training along with conventional therapy Method
interventionNames: Diagnostic Test: Body weight supported treadmill training along with conventional therapy

interventions.name: Body weight supported treadmill training along with conventional therapy
interventions.description: Using Body weight supported treadmill training along with conventional therapy Method
armGroupLabels: Body weight supported treadmill training along with conventional therapy

primaryOutcomes.measure: For lower extremity among chronic stroke patients
primaryOutcomes.description: comparison of neurodevelopmental treatment vs body weight supported treadmill training along with conventional therapy on lower extremity among chronic stroke patients

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Application of M-Cog test for checking patients cognition.
* Chronic ischemic stroke patients.
* Both Male and Female Patients.
* Patients of 35 or above years of age.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients with history of recurrent stroke.
* Patients with lower limb fractures or dislocations.
* Patients with Peripheral vascular disease
* Patients with skin discoloration or skin ulcers.

locations.facility: • General Hospital. • Chaudhary Muhammad Akram Teaching and Research Hospital, University of Lahore Teaching Hospital, Shadman Medical Center, Services Hospital, Bahria International Hospital
